title: 旧约 - 诗篇(Psalms) - 第 73 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 诗篇(Psalms) -- 第 73 章 ( 本篇共有 150 章 )

lineList.en: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
lineList.cn: （亚萨的诗）神实在恩待以色列那些清心的人。

lineList.en: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
lineList.cn: 至于我，我的脚几乎失闪。我的脚险些滑跌。

lineList.en: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
lineList.cn: 我见恶人和狂傲人享平安，就心怀不平。

lineList.en: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
lineList.cn: 他们死的时候，没有疼痛。他们的力气，却也壮实。

lineList.en: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
lineList.cn: 他们不像别人受苦，也不像别人遭灾。

lineList.en: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
lineList.cn: 所以骄傲如链子戴在他们的项上。强暴像衣裳遮住他们的身体。

lineList.en: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
lineList.cn: 他们的眼睛，因体胖而凸出。他们所得的，过于心里所想的。

lineList.en: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
lineList.cn: 他们讥笑人，凭恶意说欺压人的话。他们说话自高。

lineList.en: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
lineList.cn: 他们的口亵渎上天，他们的舌毁谤全地。

lineList.en: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
lineList.cn: 所以神的民归到这里，喝尽了满杯的苦水。

lineList.en: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
lineList.cn: 他们说，神怎能晓得。至高者岂有知识呢。

lineList.en: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
lineList.cn: 看哪，这就是恶人。他们既是常享安逸，财宝便加增。

lineList.en: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.
lineList.cn: 我实在徒然洁净了我的心，徒然洗手表明无辜。

lineList.en: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
lineList.cn: 因为我终日遭灾难，每早晨受惩治。

lineList.en: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
lineList.cn: 我若说，我要这样讲，这就是以奸诈待你的众子。

lineList.en: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
lineList.cn: 我思索怎能明白这事，眼看实系为难。

lineList.en: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.
lineList.cn: 等我进了神的圣所，思想他们的结局。

lineList.en: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.
lineList.cn: 你实在把他们安在滑地，使他们掉在沉沦之中。

lineList.en: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
lineList.cn: 他们转眼之间，成了何等的荒凉。他们被惊恐灭尽了。

lineList.en: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
lineList.cn: 人睡醒了怎样看梦，主阿，你醒了，也必照样轻看他们的影像。

lineList.en: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
lineList.cn: 因而我心里发酸，肺腑被刺。

lineList.en: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
lineList.cn: 我这样愚昧无知，在你面前如畜类一般。

lineList.en: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
lineList.cn: 然而我常与你同在。你搀着我的右手。

lineList.en: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
lineList.cn: 你要以你的训言引导我，以后必接我到荣耀里。

lineList.en: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
lineList.cn: 除你以外，在天上我有谁呢。除你以外，在地上我也没有所爱慕的。

lineList.en: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
lineList.cn: 我的肉体，和我的心肠衰残。但神是我心里的力量，又是我的福分，直到永远。

lineList.en: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
lineList.cn: 远离你的，必要死亡。凡离弃你行邪淫的，你都灭绝了。

lineList.en: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
lineList.cn: 但我亲近神是与我有益。我以主耶和华为我的避难所，好叫我述说你一切的作为。
